title: White House Social Media Data Visualization
description: In this Coding Challenge, I discuss how to use the newly released White House social media data to make simple data visualization example with p5.js.

timestamps.title: Describe the format of the data
Create a key based on the year and month
Explain how to count instances with an identifier
Create an object to count tweets
Draw a bar for each month
Use the count for the height of the bars
Consider the minimum and maximum values to normalize the data
Resize the height of the bars
Create an object to count words
Consider the text of all tweet
Count the frequency of the words
Find the most frequent word in each month
Mention video 'Term Frequency - Inverse Document Frequency' for an alternative analysis.
Extract the words for each month.
Iterate through the words to consider the most frequent value
Clean up data to ignore a set of words

codeExamples.title: Obamathon Word Count by Date Example
codeExamples.description: This sketch highlights the words used in the tweets from the White House with a bar chart.
